intro: Cleisostoma luopingense, commonly known as the Luoping cleistostoma, is a rare species of epiphytic orchid native to China. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and intricate floral structure. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, organic-rich substrates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
